replies.body: You're missing out on a bigger part of the picture. You should post all 3 games that caused the punishment. They can be found on your in-client reform card when you attempt to login. It also takes into account your previous punishment history, so anything that would have been as light as a chat-restriction would be escalated.
Each and every report is validated for accuracy. If the 'joke reports' from your friends are investigated and found to be correct .. they count.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Tantram,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=tAKtJJsv,comment-id=000100010001,timestamp=2016-03-01T19:13:22.384+0000)
>
> Each and every report is validated for accuracy. If the 'joke reports' from your friends are investigated and found to be correct .. they count.

This is just a question out of curiosity. How do you know if a report is false or not? i.e.: jungle didn't gank, reporting you - isn't really a valid reason to report someone, but people will report for trolling. This hasn't happened to me, but how do you validate the reports so things like this won't happen?

They have access to a _very_ large amount of data of the game in question when they investigate that they can audit to recreate the picture and find out if it was false or if it really happened. For example, if they go in to look at match data and see that you didn't actually do anything warranting a report, then the specific report is invalidated. Their future reports will lose more and more credibility as they report for superfluous things like not getting a gank.

Let's say, in another case, they go in to audit a report for trolling and see:

1. Chat logs of you telling them to stop following you through the jungle stealing your camps
2. Progression data that suggests they really did follow you through the jungle for 5 minutes taking gold/exp
3. Post-game report comments saying "X player/champ followed jungler around stealing camps"

then the investigation has validated the reports and an appropriate action would be taken.

And then they come in complaining about how they got banned over one game, and how they only see one game on the "reform" card.

The email only contains one game. This is due to email length issues. Long emails can be rejected in many cases.

The in-client reform card will always contain between 1 and 3 games, depending on how many were considered for your punishment. The in-client reform card never changes.
